h3. Problem Definition
Advanced Service desk managers would like to have a better control on how organizations are being operated

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a Webhook trigger to be fired when any changes are performed within organizations (user removed or added from it, for example).


h3. Workaround 
Right now don't have any, as there are also no API calls to create a script to that.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4651].
  {panel}

h3. Problem
When using automation rules on JIRA SD, approvers are not able to be set to be notified when the time remaining SLA condition is set on the "When" field.

The following warning is displayed:
"Approvers doesn't work with the current "When" trigger. Remove the recipient or consider a new trigger"

This feature would be necessary to notify approvers before the SLA be breached in JIRA SD. They can receive transition notifications from events, although it does not let they receive a new notification before the SLA be breached.

h3. Solution
Add a feature to let approvers receive notifications before the SLA be breached.

h3. Workaround
Use a transition to notify approvers when the issue need their approval or use external plugins
fields.summary: Let approvers be notified of the SLA time remaining condition

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4650].
  {panel}

The field used to store the SLA value only has numeric operators, but no "is empty" test. 

Step to reproduce :
 * Configure an SLA in a way some of the requests are not matched
 * Try to create a JQL expression specifically matching the missed issues.

Needed for :
 * Checking that the JSD admins / project admins are not missing any issues in the SLA configurations.
 * Checking the SLA configuration matches a specific set of issues

Related to : [https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/46082572]

Affects Versions : 1.2.6.1, 3.2.7, 3.3.0

h4. Workaround
# Create a saved filter like "My SLA Not Empty" with JQL like: project = MYPROJECT AND filter != "My SLA Not Empty"
# Reference the saved filter in a NOT query: project = MYPROJECT AND filter != "My SLA Not Empty"

https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Jira-questions/Find-issues-with-specific-SLA-field-beeing-empty/qaq-p/261489#U77355
fields.summary: Add an "is empty" operator on the JSD "SLA" field type.

fields.description:
h5. +Issue Summary+

When a user modifies Seraph to allow JIRA to redirect to a different page if the have an SSO in place, it is expected that when they logout from JIRA Service Desk, they would be redirected to the logout page they specified in the seraph.xml file.

The logout function works correctly if it is triggered by from within JIRA Core.

h5. +Actual Problem+

Due to the way JIRA Service Desk code for logout which checks if the login section of the Seraph has been configured to determine if an SSO has been configured, if the user does not change the login parameters, JIRA Service Desk would ignore the logout redirection and always go to the default logout page.

h5. +Feature Request+

Can a check be made toward the logout section of the code in particular separating it from the login to ensure Service Desk can determine that this page has been changed and respect the specified redirection set by the user?
fields.summary: Improvement to Custom Logout.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4643].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Ability to create multiple unique forms under an individual issue/request type

h3. Suggested Solution
Customer can continue to create individual request types, but if they have a requirement to have 20-30 unique forms then customer is going to have 20-30 unique issue/request types which of course would become unmanageable over time.

h3. Why this is important
It would be incredibly useful to have the ability to create multiple unique forms under an individual issue/request type so that you can capture the right information at the first point of contact from the customer. The best example for this would be Service Requests as they can come in all different flavors.

Possible Service Requests that would need a unique form are as follows:

* New employee request form
* Employee leaving form
* Database access request form
* Hardware ordering form
* Software ordering form
* Basically anything that either needs to be approved or tracked.
 
h3. Workaround 
No
fields.summary: Ability to create multiple unique forms under an individual issue/request type

{panel}
h5. +Issue Summary+

With the release of the recent Service Desk (v 3.3) the option to customize a Service Desk template was added and users are able to add specified variables to the template as described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedeskserver033/managing-service-desk-notifications-861255295.html#Managingservicedesknotifications-Includeissueinformationusingmessagevariables].

There is however no way for customers to add values coming from custom fields or other fields not in the listed ones in the documentation above.
h5. +Requested Feature+

Can a feature like this be added to the Service Desk Mail customization or if it has been added, can it be documented?
h5. +Existing Functionality+

There is no function that fulfills the above from our test.
h5. +Workaround+

A custom field value can be added as part of the ${request.details} variable.
 In order for the field to show up in the notifications, you will need to add the field as visible in the issue types.

We realize there will be some excessive information included additionally in the notifications, but this is the only way it can be done in an out of box JIRA at the moment.

(i) _An enhancement on :_ https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSD-4418
fields.summary: Ability To Add Custom Field Values to Service Desk Notification Template

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4638].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, there's no option to configure the default share preference of a ticket. When the reporter belongs to an Organisation, his  request will be shared among the organisation unless he changes it to "Private request" manually. This could lead to accidental oversharing if he forgot to set to "Private request". 

Also, a notification will be sent to all users within the organisation if "share with Organisation" option is accidentally chosen.
By default the sharing level of new requests is "Private", it should be possible to set a project-level default for this field to share the request with the user's assigned organisation.

In the event that a user is a member of more than one organisation, then the field should default to "Private" to avoid accidental oversharing.


h3. Suggested Solution
* Allow admin to set the default level as Issue Security Level.

h3. Why this is important
* To avoid accidental oversharing of data
* To avoid spam notification within the organisation
fields.summary: Allow administrators to set the default sharing level of new requests

h3. Summary
When a new Service Desk is created, JIRA Service Desk doesn't check for existing sub-task types with the same name as the default issue types created by JSD.
This will cause JSD to map valid request types to sub-tasks, which is not supported and hence throw an error when creating new requests.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create sub-tasks with the same name as the JIRA Service Desk issue types (e.g. Incident / Problem / Service Request)

# Navigate to the the *new project > Project Settings > Request Types*.

!incident.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

* Create a new issue type so that the mapping works properly.
* Prompt users that the issue type is already mapped to a sub-task and hence one of the issue types will have to be renamed.

h3. Summary
When a request is created (which needs approval) and then closed before being approved, it still appears in the approvers list and still can be approved

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set up approvers
# Set up a "Close issue" transition visible in the portal for Customers
# Create a request which requires approval
# Before it's approved, close the request

h3. Expected Results
# The approval is no longer needed
# Request no longer appears in "Awaiting Approval" for the approver
# Approver no longer able to approve/reject the request

h3. Actual Results
# Approver still sees this request as needing his/her approval
# When opening the request, the approver can still approve/reject

h3. Notes
Approving/Rejecting the request has no effect to it. It will remain closed.

h3.Workaround
No known workaround

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When searching for issues using "Customer Request Type" or editing a condition in an Automation rule using "Customer Request Type", the result turns into non-user friendly characters. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Service Desk project (or navigate to an existing one)
# Go into the Service Desk project settings
# Create a Request Type - > <give it a name>
# Go to issue navigator -> search for issues (Customer Request type = <given name>). 
# And also try to search for it under the Automation Rule by editing a condition. 

h3. Expected Result

# The search should return the actual Request Type name

h3. Actual Result

# The request type is returned in the following format:
#* When searching from Issue Navigator using this as an example -> "Customer Request Type" = help and support
 !issue-nav.png|thumbnail! 
#* When editing an automation rule using the same JQL query -> "Customer Request Type" = help and support
 !automation-edit.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Workaround

No current known workaround

h3. Observations

In previous versions of ServiceDesk (3.0.x), searching for Request Type was done using this format -> "*_project-key/lowercased-form-requesttype-title-hyphenated_*", however in later versions (3.2.x) an Autocomplete function was introduced when searching for Request Types after which I believe this issue started happening
fields.summary: When searching using Customer Request Type, characters change to a non user friendly form

h3. Summary
Logged Service Desk customers can't comment in Public Confluence Knowledge bases despite having the required permissions to do so, since anonymous access to publish comments are allowed.

h3. Environment
JIRA Service Desk

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a SD project
# Create a knowledge linked with this SD
# Make this Knowledge base public and enable anonymous comments
# Login with a SD customer
# Go to this Knowledge base

h3. Expected Results
Just as anonymous customers, SD logged customers should be able to perform comments.

h3. Actual Results
SD Customers can't perform comments, not even anonymous ones.
 

h3.Workaround
No workaround

h3. Problem Definition
Currently customers would be able to remove an organization from a request resulting other customers in the same organization to not receive notification and access to the request.

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, using the Organisations in Jira Service Desk for customers, customers can share created issues within their organisation. 

The customer would want a solution for sharing issues of specific issue type with a group of customers.

For example, the organization "Employees" can open issue in "Computer" Request Type to ask about keyboard and mouse. But organization "Technical" can open issue in "Network" Request Type to ask about network problem. Customers from the organisation "Employees" can only see issues from the "Computer" Request type. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add possibility for Request Type permission in Jira Service desk
 
h3. Workaround 
Create separate projects for issues with specific Request Type and add organisation for this specific project only
fields.summary: Add ability to share issues based on Request types

h3. Problem Definition
When attempting to invite a large of customers in Service Desk, inputting more than 40+ customers emails will make the "Send invite" button disappear from view and the user is unable to scroll down to click on the "Send invite" button.
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Resizing the screen does not help as the invite customers dialog box scales along with the page.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add a scrollbar to the UI so that the user can scroll down and click on the "Send invite" button.
 
h3. Workaround 
Press the "Enter" key after clicking on the field to invite the users instead.
fields.summary: Include a scrollbar when inviting a large number of customers.

Expected after clicking:

h3. Problem Definition
With SDS 3.2.x, the customers are not able to mention Agents through comments or within the Automation Rules

h3. Steps to Reproduce the Problem
h5. Through Comment
# Log in on the Customer Portal
# Create an issue
# Try to mention an Agent with the following:
#* {code}[~user@example.com]{code}
# The comment is added to this ticket, but no notification is sent

h5. Through Automation Rules
# Create an Automation Rule to add public comments and mentioning Agents with the option *Run as the user who triggered the rule* when an issue is created
# The comment from the step ahead is added to the issue, but the notifications are not sent

h3. Expected Behavior
The notification should be sent properly. 
If an Agent proceed with this (Steps to reproduce the problem), the notification is sent as expected.

h3. Actual Behavior
The comment is added, but no notification is sent
fields.summary: Mentions from customers are not triggering notifications to Agents

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA Service Desk notifications for customer do not obey ordinary notification scheme, which is a good way to split notification sending and also is good to edit the e-mail content. However, you are only able to set up notification sending (to costumers) with the following options: Reporter or Customers Involved (request participants). This can limit some cases, like e.g: You have other 'User fields' for people like Stakeholders, who should receive some specific notifications. 



h3. Suggested Solution
Be able to add other entities for the 'To:' field in customer notifications, like Customer Field Value (as it has on notification schemes) or be able to add customers or customers within a custom field into notification scheme (which currently don't work as JIRA Notification schemes work only for internal users not customers)

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 10 December 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#deebff|titleBGColor=#deebff|bgColor=#deebff}Hi everyone,

Thank you for your interest in this issue.

As a part of [Jira Service Management Data Center 4.21|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagement/jira-service-management-4-21-x-release-notes-1096102630.html#JiraServiceManagement4.21.xreleasenotes-requests] we have released column configuration on the Help center’s request list view. This allows Jira admins to select the columns that they would like to appear in their customer's requests list. It also allows customers to configure and order the columns.

The available fields are type, reference, summary, status, service project, requester, created date, updated date, due date, assignee and priority.

Please refer to our documentation to [learn how to configure the requests list|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicemanagementserver/configuring-request-view-1095250690.html].

Kind regards,

Charlie Marriott
Jira Service Management, Data Center & Server
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

It currently is not possible to add or remove columns and filters on the "My Requests" page of the customer portal.
h3. Suggestion
 * Ability to configure the columns a customer sees in the help center when viewing their list of request/s. Example would be to remove the "service project" column, but add a "date entered" column.
 * It would be nice if the My Request page could get customized, providing the ability to add or remove particular columns and filters. This would allow for customers to filter their requests more efficiently.
fields.summary: Change columns in Customer Portal 'requests' page

fields.description:
h5. Problem definition
When a .gif file is attached on a JIRA SD Ticket from within the JIRA Issue View (even if the Agent hit the option "Share With Customer"), it does not show on Customer Portal, returning an HTTP 403 error. 
This has been reproducible on multiple browsers and affects only .gif files.

h5. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a customer request
# As an agent, navigate to the issue from within JIRA and attach a .gif file (using the "Share With Customer" option)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When editing an external comment (for instance to correct the spelling of a comment) there are 2 options available:
# Share with Customer
# Add to issue only
The second option creates the impression that the edit of the comment will only result in the edit taking place, and no notification event to be triggered, whereas the share with customer option created the impression this will trigger a notification event towards the customer.
Instead, when the add to issue only option is being used, the external comment will be set to internal upon saving
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk
# Raise a request on behalf of a customer
# Add a comment to the request
# Edit the comment from step 3 and choose "add to issue only"

h3. Expected Results
The comment gets edited, and no notification gets triggered. The comment remains visible for the customer.
h3. Actual Results
The comment gets edited, and no notification gets triggered. The comment changes from external to internal and as such will not be visible for the customer anymore
fields.summary: "Add to issue only" option when editing an external comment sets the comment to internal

project.name: Jira Service Management Server and Data Center

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4573].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, when the MIME message in the mail headers do not obey the [RFC2183|http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc2183.txt] convention, the only error message that can be seen in the Email Requests is {{There was an error reading the body of email message}}. The only way to find out the information on why the emails are being rejected is to check the log on Atlassian Support end.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be great if the email request can provide more detailed explanation why the emails are being rejected (e.g: there is a problem with the email header) so that it will be visible to the users

h3. Why this is important
The customer will have the awareness that JIRA Service Desk can only accept email with headers that obey the specific criteria.
fields.summary: Provide detail information on the error message why the email is being rejected

h3. Summary
In Firefox, when creating a Service Desk issue, the dropdown list used by certain fields does not get displayed after first click.

h3. Summary

If a ticket raised by JSD customer is move to another JIRA Software project and customer responds to the notification mail (its subject contains the original issue key in Service Desk project) with an email that contains an attachment, the attachment will be added to the moved issue without any trace in the issue and without any comments. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two projects : One Service Desk project and one Software project.
# SD customer create a new Service Desk ticket via email and make sure you have received a notification informing the creation of new ticket.
# Move the ticket to Software project
# SD customer responses to the notification received in step 2 with some comments and an attachment

h3. Expected Results
Comments and attachment being added to the moved ticket in Software project if the reporter has the necessary permission.
Or create a new ticket in the Service Desk project.

h3. Actual Results
Only attachment is added to the moved ticket but without any trace.
(no issue activity is logged)
fields.summary: JSD mail handler add attachment to ticket which has been moved to Software project without any trace

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4551].
  {panel}

h3. Context

Since [04 Jul 2016|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/what-s-new-686863216.html#What'sNew-servicedesk], SD Agents can now always create customer accounts in all JIRA Service Desk Cloud instances:
{quote}Agents can add new customers to a service desk regardless of how request permissions are configured. Agents can add new customers by inviting them from the Customers page, raising a request on their behalf, or adding them as request participants on an email request. Previously, agents could only add new customers to the service desk when the request security was set to 'anyone can create a customer account'.
{quote}
This has been a great feature.
h3. Problem definition

Accounts created by Agents from the Customers page use the email as the value of:
 # customer's email
 # customer's username
 # customer's full name

Therefore:
 * Agents frequently don't know their customer names because they couldn't store the user's full name on issue creation.
 * Usernames are too long strings, so customers cannot login with shorter credentials.
 * Customers cannot share tickets with other users within their organization by typing their names.

h3. Suggested solution

Build a way in which Agents can also set appropriate usernames & full names on account creation from the Customers page.
h3. Related previous suggestion

There's already a previous similar suggestion, created before 04 Jul 2016, on which the request of change had a much more limited context, as it only affected when the request security was set to 'anyone can create a customer account': JSD-1197

However, the scope change in the context makes JSD-1197 an obsolete request on Cloud instances, as now it forcibly applies to every Service Desk project in all Cloud instances.
fields.summary: Agents should be able to set username & full name of customers

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4550].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
When emails contain text formatting, such as text coloring etc, the strip quote option does not appear to properly function anymore.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Service Desk project
# Add a mail channel to the project
# Create an issue through mail
# Trigger a notification to be send from JIRA towards the customer account
# The notification will contain the \{\{—Write replies above—}}. Write a reply above this line, and apply some color changes to the text in the mail

h3. Expected Results
The mail body gets added to the Service Desk request where only the text above the \{\{—Write replies above—}} gets added
h3. Actual Results
The whole body content will get added to the request, including the original notification content originating from Service Desk.
h3. Notes
In certain situations it appears duplicate comments are being created. The first comment added to the request displays only the content above the \{\{—Write replies above—}} line, whilst the "duplicate" comment adds the complete mail body.
fields.summary: Strip quotes not working on incoming mails containing text formatting

{panel}
Hello.
h5. Summary
 # JIRA v7.2.4
 # JIRA Service Desk Application v3.2.5
 # Confluence 6.0.2
 # Database MSSQL 2012
 # JAVA 1.8.0_112

h5. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install JIRA Service Desk
 # Install Confluence 6.0.2
 # Connect Confluence + JIRA SD
 # Create KB in non-latin characters
 # Open a customer portal and try to find a non-Latin words

h5. Expected Results

The JIRA Service desk need to find items that are transferred to these words or labels in knowledge base Confluence.
h5. Actual Results

JIRA service desk in customer portal don't find non-latin label name and content in knowledge base Confluence.
h5. Notes
h5. Note 1

JIRA service desk in customer portal don't find non-latin label name and content in knowledge base Confluence. 
 For example there is an article contains the text "test тест δοκιμή Prüfvorschrift specifikace спецификация není Latin", the fat in the confluence find only words consisting entirely of the Latin letters (spetsifikatse, test, Latin), and the words "тест δοκιμή Prüfvorschrift спецификация není" will not be found.

But search directly from the confluence is working properly, and all of the search words work.
h5. Note 2

The search works with non-latin character when it is done from the request creation form.

 

  !jira1.png|thumbnail! !jira2.png|thumbnail! !jira3.png|thumbnail! !jira4.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: JIRA service desk in customer portal don't find non-latin label name and content in knowledge base Confluence.

  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
When a ticket is shared with the Organisation, all users within the organisation will receive notification of the updates. This causes spam to the end users. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide the ability to disable the notification within the organisation.

h3. Workaround
Set the notification to be sent to *Reporter* only:
# Go to *Project Settings > Customer notifications*
# *Edit* the *Organization added* notification rule
# Under *To* field
#* Remove *Customers involved* 
#* Add *Reporter (customer)*

Note that this will cause all participants not receiving any notification, even they are not in the organisation but added separately.
fields.summary: Ability to Disable Notification Within Organisation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Service Desk Server*. Using *JIRA Service Desk Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSDCLOUD-4538].
  {panel}

For service desk it would be useful to have the in-built processor be able to check the actual address a message was delivered to.

We operate multiple service desks each with their own email address which is attached to a distribution group that in turn delivers to a central email account (We pay a subscription fee for each mailbox in operation)

As the in-built processor works at the mailbox level rather than filtering the mailbox contents based on the address we've had to use the JIRA email handler to process tickets for our service desks but as specified in the documentation the downside is that the requests don't show up as service desk customer requests.

It would be great to be able to poll a single mailbox using the in-built processor and to be able to filter to the appropriate project based on the delivery address.
fields.summary: Support for multiple service desks each using a different email address but sharing a mailbox.
